intro: Rinorea scorpioidea, commonly known as the scarab beetle plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves that resemble the shape of a scarab beetle, giving it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Rinorea scorpioidea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils with partial to full sunlight.
